meanings.definition: To completely remove or get rid of something.
meanings.sent1: I will eliminate all the weeds from the garden.
meanings.sent2: The detective was able to eliminate all the suspects except one.
meanings.sent3: After using the new cleaning product, I was able to easily eliminate the stubborn stains.
meanings.sent4: She aimed to eliminate any doubts from her mind like erasing words from a page.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's power was to eliminate evil with a single touch.

meanings.definition: To defeat or remove from a competition or game.
meanings.sent1: The basketball team hoped to eliminate their opponents in the final match.
meanings.sent2: The chess player strategically planned to eliminate the opponent's pieces.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to eliminate the toy mouse in a playful game of 'hunt'.
meanings.sent4: The knight's sword swiftly moved to eliminate the enemy in one swift strike.
meanings.sent5: The ninja's mission was to eliminate all obstacles in his path to victory.

meanings.definition: To exclude or disregard something from consideration.
meanings.sent1: Please eliminate any options that do not meet the criteria.
meanings.sent2: The judge had to eliminate biased opinions from the trial.
meanings.sent3: I had to eliminate distractions to focus on my homework.
meanings.sent4: She decided to eliminate negative thoughts from her mind like clearing a cluttered room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's goal was to eliminate any unfair advantages during the test.
